song.title: Johnny I Hardly Knew Ya
song.chorus: With yer guns and rum, and rum and guns Hurroo, Hurroo With yer guns and rum, and rum and guns Hurroo, Hurroo With yer guns and rum, and rum and guns The enemy nearly slew ya, Oh Johnny boy you'll be destroyed Johnny I hardly knew ya
song.verse: We boarded the ship most eagerly Hurroo, Hurroo Drinking and carousing merrily Hurroo, Hurroo For we all knew where the ship had been, sailing for gold and back again. We were more like a kennel of hounds than men. Johnny I hardly knew ya

When it rained on our first night at sea Hurroo, Hurroo Blacking out the kings navy Hurroo, Hurroo Yonder vessel the boatswain cried, our galleon hitting their ship broadside And our thirst for blood did coincide Johnny I hardly knew ya

His efforts they were all for naught Harroo, Harroo They took his arm with a cannon shot Harroo, Harroo A stab in the eye, a slice in the gut, and ended it all with a kick in the butt They let Johnny know just what was what Johnny I hardly knew ya

When we returned to our port city Harroo, Harroo Twenty sea rogues in absentee Harroo, Harroo Then on the road in sweet Athy, a stick in the hand, a drop in the eye A doleful damsel I heard cry Johnny I hardly knew ya

Where are the legs with which you run Harroo, Harroo The enemy came and left me none Harroo, Harroo Where are the legs with which you run, when first you went to carry a gun Oh Johnny your dancing days are done, and Johnny I hardly knew ya
